posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Glad you are having fun with the modules Aquarius, now let's proceed with the build.

If you want to keep it with Gnome that's fine but best would be a Dwarf with STR 16(18)/ CON 18(18)/ INT 16(19) equipped with a Greatsword/ GreatAxe. If staying Gnome then equip a Scimitar two-handed for a good dmg boost. You can also delay your third INT boost for last and take the other two STR attributes before that. You just have to take the last WIZ level at 20th instead of 19th lvl. If build primarily for modules, i would also question the usability of Craft Wands so this can be replaced with Empower/ Maximize Spell that is vital for any spellsword in my book. Also i would consider dropping the single rogue lvl for another WIZ one, thus attaining 3 attacks/ Round. You won't miss that much the +2 tumble AC with the defensive buffs a spellsword can have on himself & the extra CL helps a lot.

One other thing, consider dropping this into your override folder, some modules like Aielund have a similar fix already incorporated into EMS but this will do it for all modules alike.

https://neverwintervault.org/project/nw ... -spell-fix

Both builds are nice Aquarius, might i suggest to have more confidence in your spellcasting abilities as well and take GSF in Necro for example? What do you think is the difference between your build (with GSF) and another Mage that tries to get the highest DC for his spells? Let me answer that. 3. points. Unlike the Epic builds where one focussed spellcaster will take Gr INT X and ESF in his area of expertise, here the only thing that differs will be the final INT score. In other words you can be a really good mage in addition to being a spellsword! Forget about save boosters and toughness, go for the good ones, GSF in Necro and get a Wail of the Banshee's DC of 33! Spell penetration won't be a problem at these levels, you are nearly a pure mage and when you blast someone (except monks) with a Mord's you lower his SR by Ten (10) points. Don't want to spend a 9th slot for that? Fine, do a Greater Spell Breach then which is a 6th one for Five (5) points. And keep your full plate in a quick-slot so you can put it on in a hurry, preferable after you have fully buffed with premo, extended mantle, shadow shield, etc.

EDIT: I believe the reason why you were not able to replicate my starting scores is because you put 12 DEX in there as well, while i would simply do that with a Cat's Grace once i have my full plate. No reason to spend points in DEX really if all you want is a mere 12...

It doesn't have to be evocation, but my answer is "Blast away!"
Wizard players often say that sorcerers are "limited" casters and mean their limited number of known spells.
Sorcerer players then answer that wizard is the limited caster class since they only have a limited number of each spell prepared.
In this build I wanted to keep the spontaneous cast flexibility that let you pour out enormous amounts of a given spell when you need to, or want to.

You can easily pick enough spells to be able to buff your melee presence effectively:
Self buffed empowered Cat's can bring dex to 22 or 23 for a max self buffed AB of 25 together with GMW (23 for dual wielding).
Damage is taken care of by the shortsword for 1-6, empowered Bull's for up to +3 (+1 offhand), GMW +5 and Flame weapon 1-4 +10. Hasted you get 5 attacks per round with an average of about 120 damage per round on low AC targets.
Self buffed AC is: 4 deflection AC from Shield, 5 neutral AC from Shadow shield, 1 armor AC from Mage armor, and 5 dodge AC from MA and Haste, and AC from Cat's, ending at about 33. Factor in Premonition, Improved invisibility and the reciprocal damage shields.
All that is about melee presence, so it is not only a caster, even if I have given most attention to the casting.

As for what school to pick, Necromancy is a very strong candidate, but Evocation is absolutely a viable alternative. You can even pick Transmutation if you want to spam Flesh to stone.  No matter what school you choose, it is important to pick spells that target different saves,so you have spells that target the weak save of your opponent, be it  low fortitude,  low reflex or even low will. Necromancy is generally better vs creatures with low fortitude and Evocation is better vs creatures with low reflex saves.

When I talk about blasting, I think of how many times you can cast a given spell with all the metamagical options (silent, empower, max and quicken). If you wade into an area with foes that are vulnerable to fire, this character can cast Firebrand more than 30 times and back it up with 14 fireballs before he has to resort to 15 castings of Burning hands. If you don't want to do that, you can choose to spam 6 Wails and 12 Fingers of Death and still have all your level 6 slots and below for backup.
That is why I want all the metamagical feats in there, so he can cast his spells from more slots.
Even though this is a spellsword, if I build with sorcerer, I want him to be able to act like a sorcerer. If not, you can just as well build with wizard.

The Human version is my kind of Cleric! I would replace Expertise with Improved Critical, but not everybody will agree.

NPCs will identify you as a Fighter because that's what you are at level 1, which is probably not a problem.

You could start with 15 STR and still end at 18 STR, which would allow you to start with 14 CON and 14 INT (or 14 CON, 12 INT, and 10 DEX, if you take my advice to replace Expertise with Improved Critical).

You could do something similar with the Dwarf version: Start with 15 STR, increasing to 16 later, and use those 2 points to start with 16 CON and 14 INT.

For spell power, I see that with bard lv 12 you lose the use of extended improved invisibility, energy buffer and greater dispelling...but the latter can be replaced by scrolls (if they are present in the module/server).
Ba19/F1 is a tweaked strength based Ba20. The fighter level saves you feats by providing AP Heavy, WP Martial and even offers an extra bonus feat. The level 19 and 20 songs are almost identical, and both are hard to get enough Perform for. The hit on spells is not dramatic.

Ba16/F4 gets a 4th attack and 3 bonus combat feats, including WS. You still have the level 16 song. With Cha 16 and a skill focus, you can reach perform 29 and self buff it to 30 (or use an item with a skill bonus). You need bonus slots if you want level 6 spells.

Ba15/F1/RDD4 gets the free feats from F1 and the +4 Str bonus and +1 AC bonus from RDD. There are 3 attacks per round. You have a level 15 song, which is almost as good as the level 16 song. AB is better than the Ba19/F1. You only have level 5 spells. GMW still gives a +5 enhancement.

Ba12/F4/RDD4 is a strong melee character with 4 attacks, bonus combat feats and AB bonus from RDD Strength. You only get a level 11 song, but it is still far better than a level 8 song. Spell casting is limited to level 4, much like rangers and paladins, and the build borders on not being a spellsword anymore. GMW now gives a +4 enhancement.
